alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:56PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Crawford and south central Washington Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1256 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Lee Creek, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea to dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Winslow... Chester... Lee Creek... Devils Den State Park... Lake Fort Smith... Locke... Mount Gayler... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 27 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
